primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God enacts agape-love through Jesus Christ to reach and transform humans who are incapable of such love by their own nature.

tekstueel_bewijs: God in Jesus Christ leads us to love.
God puts it there [love in the heart].
Jesus Christ entered it [Hell]... and emerged victorious.

object.identificatie: Agape (The restoration of the human capacity to love/be loved)
tekstueel_bewijs: the power that moves the entire universe... is the power of love.
Love is to become enfleshed, embodied in the Christian community
the luminous core of love that burns and radiates within the Trinity itself

ontvanger.identificatie: The Human Being / The Sinner / The Hearer
tekstueel_bewijs: God shows his love for us in that while we were yet sinners Christ died for us.
we could see it in her actions. We did not in the least deserve her care.
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver (the one who is loved despite unworthiness).

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / Human 'Agents and Instruments' (e.g., Frances Nance)
tekstueel_bewijs: power of the Holy Spirit to make love happen
she was... an agent and instrument of God’s love
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject, but also the Helper through the Spirit.
helper.rol_van_geest: Indwelling power that makes love 'happen' in the congregation.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, and the 'Inherent Human Incapacity'
tekstueel_bewijs: not within the realm of human capability
we, in our sinfulness and failure
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad behavior but an ontological inability ('not within our power') and the 'edge of doom' (death/hell).

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Christian community embodying agape in concrete service to one another.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Christian / The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Service to the neighbor (e.g., AIDS patients, capital campaigns, household care)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics) is explicitly presented as a result of the primary program (soteriology). 'We love, because he first loved us.'

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Holy Spirit → Jesus Christ ← Sin/Death/Human Incapacity

voorbeelden_god_subject: God in Jesus Christ leads us to love.
God shows his love for us.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We do not have the disposition to act lovingly.
I recognize myself when I hear that word 'sinner'.
We should be on our knees begging.

voorbeelden: Paul is quite seriously calling the Christian community to this way of life.
I would hate to be still overcome with passion.
Now I know in part; then I shall understand fully.
not within the realm of human capability
that which by nature they cannot have
power of the Holy Spirit to make love happen

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon centers on the 'Pouvoir' (Power/Ability). It argues that humans lack the power to love (Non-Pouvoir) and that God provides this power as a gift.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Starts with S2 (Eros), moves to the negation of human ability (~S2), then reveals S1 (Agape) as a gift from outside the system.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'Subject-switch': Christ does what the human cannot do, then empowers the human.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Yes, passion is described as 'destructive' and 'jealous,' and human nature as 'sinful.'

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon explicitly denies human capacity to fulfill the text's demands and identifies Jesus as the true Subject of the attributes of love.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: I started to envision several women from my own life... examples of love in action.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Substitute the name 'Jesus' for the word 'love'.
It is not within our power to act like this on a consistent basis.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Uses modern figures (Jeanne Moreau, Frances Nance) to illustrate the difference between eros and agape, but quickly qualifies them as 'agents' rather than self-made heroes.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The preacher already provides the theocentric reading: these people are 'instruments' of God's prior action.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and humility; moving from the pressure of 'must' to the gratitude of 'received'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic sanctification: God is the one producing the fruit.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the '60 Minutes' anecdote to the theological core is seamless and serves the actantial shift.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'call to this way of life' and the 'incapacity to do it'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ entered it [Hell]... for our sake.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir-faire' that the human lacks by nature.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: High; described as 'sinfulness and failure' and 'unlovable'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully avoids moralism by making God the Subject of the 'Agape' narrative and the human the Receiver.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is the 'Grace' corrective.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The opponent is sufficiently 'heavy' to require a Divine Subject.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in grace-oriented homiletics. By identifying Jesus as the Subject of 1 Corinthians 13, the preacher transforms a potential 'law-hammer' into a 'gospel-balm'.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the Mike Wallace anecdote's effectiveness; Greimas shows how that anecdote establishes the 'Opponent' (Eros).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek 'agape'; Greimas shows how the sermon assigns the 'Pouvoir' of agape to God rather than the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Subject-Switch' (Love = Jesus) is the engine that prevents the sermon from becoming a list of impossible demands.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of Fleming Rutledge's 'Grammar of Grace'.
